info.title: PalmOutsourcing Task (2) - Product Scraping API
info.description: RESTful API for scraping and managing e-commerce products from Amazon and Jumia. Provides comprehensive CRUD operations, batch scraping, filtering, pagination, and real-time price monitoring.

get.summary: List all products with filtering and pagination
get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of watched products with optional filtering, searching, and sorting. Supports comprehensive filtering by platform, price range, rating, category, and more. Results are cached for performance.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Filter products created after this date

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Filter products created before this date

items.example: The per_page must not be greater than 100.

message.example: An unexpected error occurred while fetching products

post.summary: Create a new product by scraping from URL
post.description: Scrape product details from the provided URL and create a new watched product. The platform (Amazon or Jumia) is automatically detected from the URL domain.

url.description: Product URL to scrape (platform auto-detected from domain)

422.description: Validation failed or scraping failed or unsupported platform

message.example: An unexpected error occurred while creating product

get.summary: Get a single product by ID
get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific product by its ID

message.example: An unexpected error occurred while fetching product

delete.description: Permanently delete a watched product from the database

message.example: An unexpected error occurred while deleting product

patch.summary: Update a product (re-scrape or toggle active status)
patch.description: Update a product by re-scraping fresh data from its source URL or toggling its active status. At least one parameter (rescrape or is_active) must be provided.

message.example: An unexpected error occurred while updating product

get.description: Retrieve aggregate statistics about watched products including total count, active products, platform breakdown, and average metrics

message.example: An unexpected error occurred while fetching statistics

post.summary: Scrape and store a single product
post.description: Scrape product details from a URL and store it in the database. This endpoint creates a new watched product by fetching data from the e-commerce platform (automatically detected from URL domain).

url.description: Product URL to scrape (platform auto-detected from domain)

422.description: Validation or scraping failed or unsupported platform

items.example: The url must be a valid URL.

post.description: Scrape and store multiple products in a single request. Maximum 50 products per batch. Platform is automatically detected from each URL's domain. Returns aggregated results with success/failure counts.

requestBody.description: Array of product URLs to scrape (platforms auto-detected)

urls.description: Array of product URLs (platforms auto-detected from domains)

items.example: The urls must not have more than 50 items.

message.example: An unexpected error occurred during batch scraping

post.summary: Trigger re-scraping of an existing product
post.description: Manually trigger scraping for an existing product to update its data. This endpoint re-fetches product information from the original source URL.

get.summary: Get list of supported e-commerce platforms
get.description: Retrieve a list of all supported e-commerce platforms with their details, domains, and supported features

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Product model for watching e-commerce products

product_url.description: URL of the product being watched

platform_id.description: Platform-specific product identifier (ASIN for Amazon, SKU for others)

scrape_count.description: Number of times product has been scraped

is_active.description: Whether product is actively being watched
